intro: Calandrinia denticulata, commonly known as the toothed-flower or rock morning glory, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Portulacaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves and vibrant, showy flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to dry conditions. Its flowers, which are often pink or red, bloom in the morning and close in the afternoon. Calandrinia denticulata is also known for its ability to thrive in poor soil conditions, making it a hardy and resilient species.
